title: MCPD File
description: Managed Care Program Data file format for reporting Grievances, Appeals, Continuity of Care records, and Out of Network requests.

planParent.description: The name of the managed care plan

submissionDate.description: Date the data was submitted to DHCS

schemaVersion.description: The version of the schema to which the submitted file adheres

grievanceId.description: Unique identifier for each submitted grievance record

parentGrievanceId.description: Links to Original Grievance when either a Resubmission or Void is sent. Leave blank when Record type = Original

grievanceReceivedDate.description: The date the plan received the grievance

grievanceType.description: Define the type or types of grievance. Must have at least one value, but may have multiple values

exemptIndicator.description: Exempt Grievance means grievance received over the telephone that is not coverage dispute, disputed health care services involving medical necessity or experimental or investigational treatment, and resolved within the next business day

appealId.description: Unique identifier for each submitted appeal record

parentGrievanceId.description: Links to Original Grievance when either a Resubmission or Void is sent. Leave blank when Record type = Original

parentAppealId.description: Links to Original Appeal when either a Resubmission or Void is sent. Leave blank when Record type = Original

appealReceivedDate.description: The date the plan received the appeal

noticeOfActionDate.description: The date the plan sent the Notice of Action to the beneficiary

appealType.description: The Appeal type that is being reported

appealResolutionStatusIndicator.description: The code for the Appeal's resolution outcome

appealResolutionDate.description: The date the plan resolved the appeal. Leave blank if Resolved Appeal = Unresolved

partiallyOverturnIndicator.description: A partially overturned appeal occurs when a benefit or service has been modified or adjusted from the original request

expeditedIndicator.description: Indicates whether the Appeal was expedited

cocId.description: Unique identifier for each submitted continuity of care record

parentCocId.description: Links to Original Continuity of Care when either a Resubmission or Void is sent. Leave blank when Record type = Original

cocReceivedDate.description: The date the plan received the Continuity of Care record

cocType.description: Indicates the type of Continuity of Care record

cocDispositionIndicator.description: Indicate disposition of Continuity of Care Request

cocExpirationDate.description: The date the Continuity of Care expires

cocDenialReasonIndicator.description: The reason for the Continuity of Care request being denied
enum: No relationship between member and provider
Provider refused to work with managed care plan
Provider and plan did not agree to a rate

submittingProviderNpi.description: The ten-digit NPI of the provider who initiated or submitted the MER on behalf of the beneficiary

cocProviderNpi.description: The ten-digit NPI of the provider to which the beneficiary is linked resulting from the COC request

providerTaxonomy.description: Indicates the taxonomy of the provider

merExemptionId.description: The unique six-digit number assigned to the MER

exemptionToEnrollmentDenialCode.description: The denial code from the Exemption Transition Data Report

exemptionToEnrollmentDenialDate.description: Date the Exemption to Enrollment was denied

merCocDispositionIndicator.description: Indicate if and how MER COC is met
enum: The beneficiary was informed that the MCP and the out-of-network FFS provider were unable to agree to a rate
The MCP has documented quality of care issues
The MCP made a good faith effort to contact the provider and the provider was non-responsive for 30 calendar days

merCocDispositionDate.description: The date on which The MER COC was determined either Met or Not Met

reasonMerCocNotMetIndicator.description: The reason for the MER COC not being met
enum: Member was not responsive to outreach
Plan did not complete outreach efforts

oonId.description: Unique identifier for each submitted out of network record

parentOonId.description: Links to Original Out of Network when either a Resubmission or Void is sent. Leave blank when Record type = Original

oonRequestReceivedDate.description: Date the Out of Network Request was received

referralRequestReasonIndicator.description: The reason the referral was requested

oonResolutionStatusIndicator.description: Approval status of the Out of Network Request

oonRequestResolvedDate.description: Date the Out of Network Request was resolved. Leave blank if Resolution Status Indicator is pending

partialApprovalExplanation.description: When OON Resolution Status Indicator = Partial Approval, document what portion of the request was approved and what portion was denied. Otherwise leave blank

specialistProviderNpi.description: Identifier of the Out of Network Specialist being requested

providerTaxonomy.description: Indicates the taxonomy of the provider. (For Out of Network, this is the Taxonomy associated with the Specialist Provider NPI)

serviceLocationAddressLine1.description: First line of the service location address

serviceLocationAddressLine2.description: Second line of the service location address

serviceLocationZip.description: ZIP Code of the service location

serviceLocationCountry.description: Must be a valid country code

recordTypeDefinition.description: Indicates the type of record.  Note that Resubmission and Void records will be rejected if there is not a previously accepted Submission with an ID that matches the Parent ID

benefitTypeDefinition.description: Defines the type of benefit that the record addresses
enum: Managed Long Term Services and Supports

planCodeDefinition.description: The plan code for each county which plan operates in. Do not report subcontracting health plans separately

cinDefinition.description: The member's CIN number as nine-characters that consists of eight numbers and one letter. CINs must lead with a 9 and end with a letter character
